properties.areaDesc: Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Western Uinta Mountains; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 3:17PM MST until January 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
...Heavy snow and strong winds to develop over Utah and southwest
Wyoming late Thursday night and Friday...

.The cold upper level trough current along the west coast will
move inland late Thursday, then continue quickly east across the
Great Basin Thursday night through Friday morning. This fast
moving storm will spread snow into western Utah late Thursday
night, with widespread snow through at least Friday morning.
Heavy snow is expected in the mountains, with a short period of
high intensity snowfall rates bringing several inches of new
snow to adjacent valley locations during the morning.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South
of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains and Wasatch Plateau/Book
Cliffs.

* WHEN...From 2 AM to 5 PM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility and produce hazardous
travel conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak snowfall intensities during the
morning will create hazardous travel conditions for the morning
commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including
Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit
weather.gov/slc/winter.

For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of
Transportation, visit
http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial
511.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY
